The simplyest language to learn!
This is "Hello, World!" example:

    .386
    .model flat, stdcall 
    option casemap :none 
    include \MASM32\INCLUDE\windows.inc
    include \MASM32\INCLUDE\masm32.inc
    include \MASM32\INCLUDE\gdi32.inc
    include \MASM32\INCLUDE\user32.inc
    include \MASM32\INCLUDE\kernel32.inc
    includelib \MASM32\LIB\masm32.lib
    includelib \MASM32\LIB\gdi32.lib
    includelib \MASM32\LIB\user32.lib
    includelib \MASM32\LIB\kernel32.lib
    .data
    message db "i herd u liek mudkipz?",0
    mestitle db "lol, win32!",0
    .code
    start:
    invoke MessageBox,0,ADDR message,ADDR mestitle,MB_OK
    invoke ExitProcess,0
    end start

00110011 00100000 00110010 01100101

btw, Assembly is probably one of the most tedious languages out there, it's not that it's hard, but more like while the average language(C, C++, Java, etc) takes around a month or two to learn, Assembly will probably take you more than a year to use proficiently. However it's well worth it, because Assembly is the language your computer reads(well actually it reads binary, but everything is converted to Assembly then to binary), so if you know Assembly you don't really have to know anything else for the most part. You'll be a god among Anons if you can master Assembly because this is probably THE most useful language to know since you can do pretty much anything you want with it.

## Links  ##

* [Art Of Assembly](http://courses.ece.uiuc.edu/ece390/books/artofasm/) - Assembly tutorial.
